result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Christina Marie Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.
-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Final Order - State moves to dismiss as the defendant has complied with all conditions of the plea diversion agreement.
Plea Diversion Final Report
Plea Diversion Agreement

11:07 A.M.  Defendant present in court with Atty Jeanne Zamzow.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Court takes a short recess to see where the file is.

Court adjourned at 11:08 a.m.

Court reconvenes at 11:11 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Jeanne Zamzow.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Zamzow - have a resolution, State will file an amended information with 2 counts - possession of Methamphetamine and possession of paraphernalia, repeater will be dismissed.  State concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Attorney Zamzow and defendant acknowledge receipt of the amended information and waives any reading.  Court instructs the defendant regarding her right to a preliminary examination.  Defendant waives her right to a preliminary examination.  Court accepts the waiver of the prelim.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on counts 1 & 2 and strikes the repeater.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today on count 2.  Court orders the judgment of conviction not be entered on count 1 and adjourns matter pending compliance with the plea diversion agreement.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Zamzow.  Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

30 days county jail, stayed and places the defendant on probation for 1 year.

CONDITIONS:

-Court costs.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.
-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
  
Court adjourned at 11:22 a.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 17, 2016 at 10:00 am.

11:09 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Jeanne Zamzow.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Zamzow - requests a plea & sentencing.  Court sets for plea & sentencing on May 17., 2016 at 10:00 a.m.

Court adjourned at 11:10 a.m.
Status hearing at 04-05-2016 11:00 am

11:21 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Jeanne Zamzow.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Zamzow - has received Discovery and requests another hearing.  Court sets for Status Hearing on April 5, 2016 at 11:00 a.m.

Court adjourned at 11:22 a.m.
State's
Plea/sentencing hearing at 02-23-2016 11:00 am

9:35 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Jeanne Zamzow.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Zamzow - has received an offer and was sent to the defendant and requests another hearing.  Court sets for Plea & Sentencing on February 23, 2016 at11:00 a.m.

Court adjourned at 9:36 a.m.
Defendant's
Status hearing at 01-04-2016 09:30 am

11:05 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Jeanne Zamzow.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Zamzow - defendant will waive the preliminary hearing.  Defendant concurs.  Court instructs the defendant regarding her right to a preliminary examination.  Defendant waives her right to a preliminary examination.  Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial.

State files an information with the court.  Attorney Zamzow and defendant acknowledge receipt of the information and waives any reading.  Atty Zamzow enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant.  Court sets for Status Hearing on January 4, 2016 at 9:30 a.m.
  

Court adjourned at 11:07 a.m.

Notice of Hearing for Status Hearing scheduled on 12/01/2015 at 11:00 a.m. has been returned.  Return to sender.  Re-sent to:  PO Box 465  Oxford, WI  53953-0465
Status hearing at 12-01-2015 11:00 am

2:55 p.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Jeanne Zamzow present.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Zamzow - defendant was at Sauk County jail, mail has been returned and does not know where defendant is.  Court sets for Mandatory appearance on December 1, 2015 at 11:00 a.m.  If no appearance - warrant.

Court adjourned at 2:56 p.m.
Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Status hearing at 11-09-2015 02:00 pm
Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.

8:54 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Jeanne Zamzow.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Zamzow confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court notes bond was set and amends to add absolute sobriety.  No objection by Atty Zamzow.  Court amends to include  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives the time limits.  Court will set for Status Hearing on November 9, 2015 at 2:00 p.m.

Court adjourned at 8:56 a.m.
